captions.text:
'Cause it's our 600th episode.
Who'd have thunk it, man?

- Just think for a second.
- I'm going to 6,000.

At least you, at least I know 
when it's gonna hit ya.

Well, fine, I'm gonna go to 6,001,
and then I'm gonna retire.

- But I'm not going to die.
- Okay, good.

Are people doing math right now
to see how long

- it's gonna take us to go...
- That's a good long time from now.
The same people who watch the show now,

they will have moved on
to other forms of entertainment
by time we get to episode 6,000.

So it's like I'm talking to people
from the future

It's a mind trip, people.
And how should we celebrate?

By asking you to tell us
how to celebrate on Facebook.

Well, Grace Watson said,
"Fist bump 600 times."
Grace, that's such a bad idea.

Well, we did give five 500 times,
so why not fist bump?

- You're ready?
- My knuckles are ready.

- Which hand you wanna use?
- I've never even counted to 600,
much less fist bumped while counting.

- You're doing it too hard.
- That's 38.

You're doing it too hard!
Don't get mad.

- I mean, these knuckles--
- I'm sorry, I'm mad that we're doing this.

These knuckles gotta make to 600,
and not you going,

"(gruffly) I'm just gonna 
fist bump harder!"

(normally) It's gonna hurt your knuckles
just as much as it hurts my knuckles.

- 1/6th of the way.
- Let's switch up.

- No. No, no.
- Keep the ring on.

- (whispering) One, two--
- Nope, uh, three, four, five,
Ow! Let's take the rings off.

Don't lose that!
Now, that's important.

Your left hand's a lot bonier
than your right hand,

or maybe my left hand
is a lot bonier than my right hand.

If we both go like this,
that's not a fist bump.

- That's a fist bro.
- We gotta be--

We can't be in sync.
We have to be the exact opposite.
Right, it's like a sine and cosine.
So what number are we on?

- All right, let's speed this up.
- Let's double up.

- We gotta speed this up.
- These count for twos.

- All right.
- These count for twosies, so if we go--

- If we count by tens--
- We'll get to 400.

(whispers) One, two, three, 
four, five, six....

Look at that!
Look how red that is.

Look how big my knuckles are.
I crack 'em all the time.

- (normally) What is that?
- I don't know!

Just don't get harder.
Get more in sync and softer.

(whispering) One, two, three, 
four, five, six, seven...

- Man, that's your fault, man!
- (laughs) No!

'Cause you started--I just started
coming when I'm going.

- Can we move to a different part?
- We're done.

No, that's 400 total.
All right, here we go.

Okay, now we gotta go to 100 again
and that'll be 600.

I put on my symbol
of ever-lasting love to my wife again.
Ooh, I didn't want it to get damaged.

Oh, the redness.
I don't know if that translates--
Let's just move on from that.

Ethan Telfer asks, "Why don't you make 
a montage of all of Link's gagging

I'm not gonna retch in this episode,
'cause that ain't me anymore.

Does it make you feel better
watching that, like you purged yourself?
No, I never actually purged anything.

My body said it wanted 
to, many times.

- Well, I hope--
- It's a form of exercise.

I hope you've cleaned 
out your insides, proverbially.

Because Joey Pedro says,
"Eat 600 cheese balls."

Dang, you're throwing
all the fun at us.

- Okay, I got--
- He actually asked us to eat 600 each,

but we thought 
that would be irresponsible,

so we're eating 600 together
'cause this is a team thing!
We just fist-bumped each other 600 times,

- let's eat 600 cheese balls together.
- This is what 300 cheese balls look like.
And I've got my own little system here.

(Link) It's not working
as well as I thought.

'Cause my thinking is if I can eat these
with a spoon, then I'm gonna
(muffled) That's why I'm using my teeth.

(Link) Now, I hope this bowl 
doesn't totally start cracking

because it is made of glass,
and I am putting a lot of pressure here.

Just let me start eating 
some of these in the middle here

- (Link) Wait, what was--
- (Rhett) [inaudible] the same technique.
I think it's gonna be pretty dry.

- Oh wow, that's a lot of powder.
- (Rhett) Yeah.

- I do like cheese balls, though.
- (Link) It's good.

Oh, going back to your bowl 
crushing technique, huh?

- I think this is working.
- No.
Oh man, I can't even chew anymore.

(Link) I literally can't part my mouth.
There's so much cheese dust in there.

We can drink water 
while we're doing this, right?

This is not a food challenge.
This is just a celebration.
What's the serving size on the container?

I dropped one.
Is that okay?

- You're really gonna do it.
- So now it's becoming about me?

- You still like cheese balls?
- Yeah.

- (belches)
- (Rhett) You want me to help you

- with those?
- I just burped up a lot of cheese powder.

I have to re-eat those.
That sucks.

Look at how much is on my hand.
That's a record.
You don't get the full experience.

(Link) All right, let's just double down
and knock 'em out, okay?

- I'm talkin' to myself and you.
- Oh.

Help me out.
Let's do this.

They don't do this on any other show,
like a newscast--

(seriously) Ladies and gentlemen,
and welcome to our 600th broadcast

of the nightly news.
I'm gonna eat 600 cheese balls.

There's probably a reason
why they don't do it.

Brian Williams, we challenge you
to a cheese ball off.

Or we'll just invite you 
to our Cheese Ball.
He's the King of the Cheese Ball.

If you ever wanna step foot 
in my county--

If you come to the Cheese Ball,
you will be the Cheese King.

Brian Williams, 
and what's his daughter's name?

Allison Williams, you have 
officially been invited

- We did it, Rhett!
- Yeah, we did it.

Thank you for your help.
Let's fist bump.

- Oh, wow.
- Oh my goodness, people.

I will never eat 
another cheese ball this week.
I thought, how about we learn something?

- How about it?
- How about it.

So we looked up what happened
in the year 600.

Well, it turns out, Link,
the Perges--The Persians--

- began to use windmills for irrigation.
- In the year 600?
to the Rhett and Link Theater.
that I've got a new accoutrement.

(Link) It's a medallion of sorts.
I got it at a shop

- in the downtown area.
- Yes, I've been there.

It's great.
Oh, do you feel that breeze?

Wonder what that'll 
do to your medallion?

- Ladies and gentlemen--
- Look at that!
Did you know it did that?

- Hey, what're you--
- (Link) You really gotta steer it.

Oh, of course, irrigation.
That's how you get water

to the crops, but there's no effective way
to do that by harnessing the wind.

Do you think that your medallion
can help with irrigation?

- Let's put it up on your home.
- Yeah, let's try.

- The large tower.
- (Link) Yeah, over here.

(Link) Okay, that's good work.
Oh, I'm losing my dress here.

Let's sit back and admire.
Look at it irrigate.

(Link) Wow, it's really working well.
I'm surprised it's fully functional.

Yeah, like not to fist bump 600 times
or eat 600 cheese balls!
You know what time it is.

Hi, I'm Angelica.
This is my little "Mythical Beast".

We're from Italy and it's time
to spin the Wheel of Mythicality.

Hey, lookie there!
We got a Good Mythical Morning hoodie.

Get you some.
Click through Good Mythical More,

where we eat some malic acid powder
and astronaut cheese pizza!
(Rhett) Shout out to Sir Walter Raleigh.
Shout out to you, Sir Walter Raleigh.

You explored the Eastern Seaboard
from North Carolina

down to Florida, 
and named it all Virginia.

(Rhett) You got arrested five times,
but you were released

(Link) The capitol of our home state,
Raleigh, North Carolina,
is named after you and that's boss!

(Rhett) And, finally, you were
beheaded in 1618,

but you took it like a champ,
your last words being,

- Sir Walter Raleigh.
- Shout out to you.

comments.text:
random fun fact for those who are wondering A.D?

originally stands for Anno Domini or "year of our lord" CE stands for 
Common Era while BCE stands for Before Common Era. Also! the person who 
thought of this entire A.D, BCE, CE at around 500 CE was named dionysius 
exiguus.﻿
